summary.purpose: Provides a 6-digit OTP (One-Time Password) code input component that renders individual digit slots with auto-focus behavior, supporting both LTR and RTL text directions.
summary.problem_solved: Abstracts OTP/verification code entry into a reusable, styled component with per-digit input slots, automatic focus on mount, and configurable layout direction for internationalized interfaces.

symbols.description: A 6-digit OTP code input component using the input-otp library. Renders six individual digit slots in a centered flex container. Automatically focuses the input on mount via a ref and useEffect. Supports customizable CSS classes for the outer and slot containers, and configurable text direction (LTR/RTL).

details.rendered_ui_description: Renders a centered row of 6 individual digit input slots, each displayed as a small rounded bordered box with shadow. The active slot shows a ring highlight. The component auto-focuses on mount so the user can immediately start typing their OTP code.

symbols.description: Internal helper component that renders a single OTP digit slot. Displays the character if present and applies active styling (border ring highlight) when the slot is currently focused.

details.rendered_ui_description: A 36x36px (size-9) rounded bordered box with shadow. Displays a single character in the center when filled. When active/focused, shows a ring border highlight with subtle ring shadow.
